page.title: 26Raasay General Description 2011
page.content:
Raasay is a small island about fifteen miles long and two miles in width. There is alot of moorland on Raasay. There is one shop and one school on the island and the population is about a hundred and fifty. There is also an outdoor centre in which you do lots of outdoor activities. To get on and of the island you have to travel by boat. In the North of Raasay there is an old ruined castle called Brochel castle. There is a few kinds of wild animals on Raasay, the Deer and the Rabbit. There used to be an old iron ore mine which had a railway on Raasay which is now in Ruins. The only way to travel around the island is to walk or go by car if you have one.

28/9/11


Contribution by: Rachel - P6
